data.title: Agriculture
data.meta_description:
Giyani - Free download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. 1. Giyani was established in the 1960s as the capital of Gazankulu homeland and is now the administrative capital of Mopani District Municipality. 

2. Originally, the land where Giyani is situated belonged to the Risinga Community led by Chief Hosi Homu Chabalala, who were removed by the apartheid government to establish Giyani. 

3. The Risinga Community successfully claimed back their traditional lands through the land claims process, which were returned to Hosi Homu Chabalala and another Chabalala chief, Hosi Siyandhani.
